title: Irrigation Department warns of critical flood situations in several river basins
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued an urgent warning stating that critical flood situations have already developed in the low-lying areas of several major river basins due to continuous heavy rainfall over their catchment areas.

title: Cyclonic storm Ditwah claims 56 lives; 21 missing
byline: A total of 56 people have died, 21 are missing, and 14 have been injured due to incidents caused by Cyclonic Storm Ditwah, according to the Disaster Management Centre (DMC).

title: Major flood alert for Kelani River Valley
byline: The Irrigation Department  have issued warnings of a potential major flood situation in low-lying areas of the Kelani River Valley over the next 48 hours, as heavy rainfall continues in upstream regions.

title: Several districts hit by intense downpours
byline: Sri Lanka has experienced exceptionally heavy rainfall across multiple regions over the past 24 hours.

title: Train services suspended after 6 a.m today
byline: The Railway Department has announced that train services on all routes will be suspended after 6 a.m. today (28) due to the prevailing adverse weather conditions experienced across the country.

title: Colombo-bound flights to be diverted to Mattala, Cochin or Trivandrum
byline: Colombo- bound flights will be diverted to the Mattala international airport, or Cochin and Trivandrum in India in case of difficulties in landing due to the inclement weather conditions, Minister Aruna Karunatilake said.

title: Allocate at least Rs. 15 billion for disaster relief: Harsha
byline: The funds allocated for disaster relief are not sufficient as at least Rs. 15 billion is needed for relief, especially for capital expenditure, MP Harsha de Silva told Parliament today.

title: Over 20,000 troops deployed to rescue people affected by severe weather
byline: The President has directed the Army to provide immediate assistance to those impacted by the prevailing adverse weather conditions across the island. Over 20,500 Army personnel have already been deployed to carry out rescue operations.

title: Provide essential services to foreign tourists hit by disaster situation: President tells Tourism Authority
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has instructed the Tourism Authority to take necessary measures to efficiently provide essential services to foreign tourists facing difficulties due to the prevailing emergency disaster situation in the country.

title: Major flood risk along Attanagalu Oya
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a warning of potential major flooding in low-lying areas surrounding the Attanagalu Oya.

title: SriLankan Airlines issues passenger travel advisory
byline: Colombo, November 28, 2025 – SriLankan Airlines has issued a travel advisory urging passengers scheduled to fly today to check the latest flight updates before heading to the airport, as adverse weather continues to affect many parts of the island.

title: Sri Lanka likely to urge for international help
byline: The government has called for an urgent meeting headed by Prime Minister Harini Amarasuriya this evening and will discuss whether an international appeal should be made for assistance as thousands remain severely affected from the cyclonic storm.

title: Rs. 1.2 billion allocated for disaster relief
byline: The government has allocated Rs. 1.2 billion (one point two billion rupees) for disaster relief services, officials confirmed.

title: Public Advisory for Sri Lankans: Staying Safe and Prepared During the Ongoing National Disaster
byline: Sri Lanka is facing a serious national disaster right now, with floods, landslides and severe transport disruptions affecting daily life across many districts. With conditions changing quickly, it’s important for all of us to stay informed, stay calm and stay prepared. I’ve put together this advisory to help families and individuals navigate the next few days safely and responsibly.

title: Cyclonic storm ‘Ditwah’ moves closer to Trincomalee
byline: The Meteorology Department announced that Cyclonic Storm Ditwah [pronounced Dit-wah] is currently positioned approximately 50 kilometres south of Trincomalee.

title: Matale records highest rainfall: Over 540 mm in 24 hours
byline: Sri Lanka experienced exceptionally heavy rainfall in the 24 hours ending at 6.00 a.m. today (28 November 2025), with Gammaduwa in the Matale District recording the highest rainfall at 540.6 mm, according to official observations.

title: President directs officials to ensure unrestricted rescue and relief operations
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has directed District Secretaries to carry out rescue and relief operations without allowing financial limitations to impede urgent assistance for communities affected by the ongoing severe weather.

title: Pakistan expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka amid severe weather crisis
byline: The Government and people of Pakistan have expressed their deepest solidarity with Sri Lanka in the wake of the ongoing severe weather crisis caused by cyclonic conditions and unprecedented heavy rainfall affecting large parts of the country.

title: India responds to Sri Lanka’s request for flood relief: Deploys INS Vikrant helicopters
byline: India has agreed to deploy helicopters from its aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, currently docked in Colombo, to support Sri Lanka’s ongoing rescue and relief operations as Cyclonic Storm Ditwah causes severe weather across the island.

title: Peradeniya University closed until further notice
byline: Severe weather conditions have forced authorities in Peradeniya to activate heightened safety measures as the overflowing Mahaweli River has inundated several low-lying areas, including parts of the Royal Botanic Gardens.

title: Over 65,000 electricity disruptions reported in Sri Lanka
byline: Severe weather across Sri Lanka has caused widespread electricity disruptions, with more than 65,000 power outages reported nationwide.

title: Sri Lanka seeks help from Indian warship in Colombo
byline: Secretary to the Ministry of Defence, Air Vice Marshal Sampath Thuyacontha, said that Sri Lanka has requested assistance from the Indian warship currently docked in Colombo, including the use of its aircraft, for ongoing rescue and relief operations amid the severe weather caused by Cyclonic Storm Ditwah.

title: Flooding blocks Kaduwela exits on Southern Expressway
byline: The Kaduwela exits of the Southern Expressway (E01), for vehicles arriving from Kadawatha, have been flooded, the Transport, Highways and Urban Development Ministry announced.

title: SJB MP resigns
byline: Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) National List MP Ismail Muththu Mohamed has resigned from Parliament with immediate effect.

title: Sri Lanka launches global diplomatic push for flood relief, PM to brief foreign envoys
byline: A diplomatic briefing will be held today, 28 November 2025, at the Prime Minister’s Office, led by the Prime Minister, to update Colombo-based Heads of Mission on the Government’s ongoing emergency flood-relief operations and recovery efforts.

title: Three dead after car plunges into Saindamarudu canal
byline: Three people died after a car veered off the road and plunged into the Boralaweli Canal in Saindamarudu earlier yesterday.

title: Central Province cut off due to damaged connecting highways
byline: The Central Province remains completely cut off from the rest of the country due to extensive damages to key highways, an official said.

title: Navy evacuates residents as floods worsen in Mahawa and Eluwankulam
byline: Evacuation operations are underway in Mahawa, Kurunegala, and Eluwankulam, Puttalam after severe flooding affected several communities this morning. The Sri Lanka Navy has deployed multiple relief teams to assist residents stranded by rising water levels.

title: Evacuation of flood affected people in North, East becomes problematic
byline: Evacuation of flood affected people in the North and the East is problematic as people in these areas are refusing to leave their homes, MP Shanakiyan Rasamanickam said today.

title: Fallen trees and flooding block several roads in Colombo
byline: Several parts of Colombo have been impacted by the adverse weather conditions sweeping across the island, with reports of flooding and fallen trees disrupting road access, the Police said.

title: Leave for all police officers cancelled
byline: Leave for all ranks of police officers have been cancelled until November 30 due to the disaster situation in the country, Police spokesman ASP F.U. Wootler said.

title: Bus with 70 passengers stranded on Kalawewa Bridge
byline: A bus carrying approximately 70 passengers has been stranded for nearly an hour and a half on the Kalawewa Bridge along the Anuradhapura–Puttalam road., Parliament was informed today (28).

title: District Secretaries instructed to obtain services of private boats if needed: Nalinda
byline: The government has instructed the District Secretaries to obtain the services of private boats if the boats assigned by the Sri Lanka Navy for relief work are not sufficient, Chief Government Whip Minister Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Major flood warning issued for Kalu River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued an urgent warning of a major flood risk in several low-lying areas of the Kalu River Basin, citing continuous heavy rainfall and rapidly rising water levels. The situation is expected to worsen over the next few hours.

title: Namal urges SLPP leaders to support weather-affected communities
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) National Organizer Namal Rajapaksa has urged all SLPP Electoral Organizers and Village Leaders to extend their fullest support to communities affected by the ongoing adverse weather.

title: Five dead, twelve missing after landslide in Hasalaka
byline: Police said thay the bodies of five people have been recovered following a severe landslide near Yahangala Mountain in the Hasalaka area.

title: Death toll from inclement weather climbs to 61
byline: The Disaster Management Centre (DMC) reported that a total of 61 persons have died and 25 remain missing as severe weather continues to affect the country.

title: Indian PM Modi expresses solidarity with Sri Lanka, says ready to help
byline: Indian Prime Narendra Modi said that India remains ready to help Sri Lanka at this time of disaster.

title: Health officials on alert for weather-related emergencies
byline: Health authorities have placed medical teams on high alert as hospitals across several districts prepare for a possible surge in patients due to the ongoing severe weather conditions.

title: India’s aircraft carrier donates relief to flood victims in Sri Lanka
byline: India’s aircraft carrier INS Vikrant, currently anchored in Colombo, has donated 4.5 tons of food items from its stock to assist flood victims in Sri Lanka.

title: Police launch helpline as adverse weather intensifies
byline: Amid ongoing severe weather across Sri Lanka, the Police have introduced dedicated telephone numbers to provide the public with information and assistance related to disaster situations.

title: Important notice for all air passengers
byline: Airport & Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited has released an important update urging passengers to stay informed as adverse weather conditions continue to impact Sri Lanka.

title: R. Premadasa stadium declared emergency relief centre
byline: The R. Premadasa International Stadium has been officially designated as an emergency relief centre to accommodate up to 3,000 people in the event of a disaster.

title: Diplomatic missions express solidarity, support in relief and recovery initiatives: Foreign Ministry
byline: Most diplomatic missions based in Colombo have expressed their solidarity and support for the Government of Sri Lanka during this challenging time, the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism said.

title: Colombo under threat of major flooding?
byline: With a water level not experienced in recent history being seen in the Kelani River, the Irrigation Department has issued an urgent warning that low-lying areas along the Kelani River may face a high-risk flood situation.

title: 15 inbound flights diverted as adverse weather disrupts BIA operations
byline: A total of 15 inbound flights have been diverted from Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) since 22:55 hrs yesterday (27) due to unsafe landing conditions caused by severe weather, airport authorities confirmed.

title: Public urged to stay alert as Kelani River nears critical level
byline: The Irrigation Department have warned residents in Colombo and surrounding areas to remain on high alert as the Kelani River continues to rise following persistent heavy rainfall.

title: Three from same family killed in Nawalapitiya landslide
byline: Three members of one family were killed when a landslide buried a house on Old Railway Yard Road in Nawalapitiya this morning (28), police said.

title: Health Ministry declares one-week emergency
byline: The Ministry of Health and Mass Media has declared a one-week emergency in the health sector, effective from today (28) until December 4, to ensure the continuous provision of medical services amid the prevailing disaster caused by Cyclone Ditwah.

title: President declares key services as essential amid disaster
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has issued an extraordinary gazette notification declaring several critical services as essential services.

title: Residential students in disaster-hit areas safe: Education Ministry
byline: All residential students in universities, colleges, and higher education institutions located in disaster-affected areas remain safe, Education, Higher Education and Vocational Education Secretary Nalaka Kaluwewa confirmed during a media briefing held today.

title: Sri Lanka invites overseas and foreign contributions for disaster relief
byline: The government has announced that Sri Lankans residing overseas and foreign nationals can contribute to relief efforts for those affected by the ongoing disaster situation in the country.

title: Moragahakanda Laggala Bridge swept away by floods
byline: The Moragahakanda Laggala Bridge, located along the Moragahakanda–Hettipola Road, was swept away by raging floodwaters.

title: Schools to reopen on December 16
byline: The Education Ministry has announced that schools across the country will reopen for the final phase of the third school term on December 16.

title: Romania’s defense minister resigns over false claims on his CV
byline: Romania’s Defense Minister Ionuț Moșteanu resigned Friday over false claims on his resume, marking the second time in recent weeks that a NATO country close to Russia has had to change its defense leadership.

title: Bad weather: Death toll rises to 69; over 30 still missing
byline: A total of 69 people have been reported dead while 34 remain missing as adverse weather continues to batter the country.

title: CBK asks government to declare emergency, seeks international support
byline: Former President Chandrika Bandaranaike Kumaratunga, commenting on the disaster situation in the country, requested the government to declare an emergency and seek support from international agencies to respond to the crisis.

title: Hong Kong tower blocks fire death toll rises to 128
byline: At least 128 people have died in a devastating fire that engulfed multiple high-rise buildings in Hong Kong.

title: Mobile providers offer free calls and data to disaster-hit areas
byline: To ease difficulties faced by the public during the prevailing disaster, mobile service providers have agreed not to deactivate telephone connections until 29 November.

title: All scheduled exams postponed – Examinations Commissioner General
byline: All scheduled examinations have been postponed due to the prevailing disaster situation in the country, Examinations Commissioner General Mrs. Indika Liyanage announced today.

title: Sri Lanka cricket team donates Pakistan series earnings to flood victims
byline: Sri Lanka’s national cricket team has decided to donate all tour money and match fees from the Pakistan series to assist those affected by the recent devastating floods and landslides across the country, Head Coach Sanath Jayasuriya said.

title: No cracks in Randenigala, Rantambe dams: DMC refutes social media posts
byline: The report circulating over social media that the Randenigala and Rantambe dams have cracked is fake, the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) said today.

title: Passengers asked to avoid bringing visitors to BIA
byline: Airports and Aviation Services (Sri Lanka) Limited has issued an important notice for passengers arriving at Bandaranaike International Airport due to adverse weather conditions affecting several access roads.

title: Red alert issued for Gampaha District as people asked to evacuate
byline: Authorities have issued a major flood warning for the Gampaha District and surrounding areas as water levels in the Attanagalu Oya rise rapidly.

title: Twelve missing after landslide in Bulathkohupitiya
byline: At least twelve people are reportedly missing following a landslide in the Dedugala area of Bulathkohupitiya.
